parameters.description: IP Address or FQDN to use to contact the SGM

parameters.name: connection_disabled
parameters.description: Indicates whether the sub-grid is currently disabled (true) or not (false).

parameters.name: connection_timestamp
parameters.description: Timestamp of the beginning of the current VPN connection with the SGM.

parameters.name: detached
parameters.description: Indicate detached state of subgrid with MGM.

parameters.name: join_status
parameters.description: Gives the overall status of the Super Grid connectivity

parameters.name: join_token_expiration
parameters.description: Timestamp when the sub grid join token expires.

parameters.name: joined
parameters.description: Indicates whether the sub-grid is currently joined or not.

parameters.name: last_event
parameters.description: Last event notified by the Super Grid Master.

parameters.name: last_sync_timestamp
parameters.description: Timestamp of the last synchronization with the SGM.

parameters.name: port
parameters.description: Alternate port number to use when connecting to the VPN endpoint.

parameters.name: use_mgmt_port
parameters.description: Indicates whether to use the management port to connect to the SGM.

get.description: Returns a list of member objects matching the search criteria

parameters.name: comment
parameters.description: A descriptive comment of the Grid member.

parameters.name: enable_ha
parameters.description: If set to True, the member has two physical nodes (HA pair).

parameters.name: enable_ro_api_access
parameters.description: If set to True and the member object is a Grid Master Candidate, then read-only API access is enabled.

parameters.name: host_name
parameters.description: The host name of the Grid member.

parameters.name: master_candidate
parameters.description: Determines if a Grid member is a Grid Master Candidate or not. This flag enables the Grid member to assume the role of the Grid Master as a disaster recovery measure.

parameters.name: preserve_if_owns_delegation
parameters.description: Set this flag to "true" to prevent the deletion of the member if any delegated object remains attached to it.

parameters.name: router_id
parameters.description: Virutal router identifier. Provide this ID if "ha_enabled" is set to "true". This is a unique VRID number (from 1 to 255) for the local subnet.

parameters.name: service_type_configuration
parameters.description: Configure all services to the given type.

parameters.description: Member that participates in the upgrade process.

parameters.name: subelement_type
parameters.description: The type of subelements to be requested. If 'type' is 'GROUP', or 'VNODE', then 'upgrade_group' or 'member' should have proper values for an operation to return data specific for the values passed. Otherwise, overall data is returned for every group or physical node.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The type of upper level elements to be requested.

parameters.description: Upgrade group that participates in the upgrade process.

ReturnFields.name: _return_fields
ReturnFields.description: Enter the field names followed by comma

ReturnFieldsPlus.name: _return_fields+
ReturnFieldsPlus.description: Enter the field names followed by comma, this returns the required fields along with the default fields

MaxResults.name: _max_results
MaxResults.description: Enter the number of results to be fetched

ReturnAsObject.name: _return_as_object
ReturnAsObject.description: Select 1 if result is required as an object

PageId.name: _page_id
PageId.description: Page id for retrieving next page of results

Schema.name: _schema
Schema.description: Return schema for this object type

Inheritance.name: _inheritance
Inheritance.description: If this option is set to True, fields which support inheritance, will display data properly.

value.description: The value of the extensible attribute.

ExtAttrs.description: Extensible attributes associated with the object.

allow_recursive_deletion.description: The property to allow recursive deletion. Determines the users who can choose to perform recursive deletion on networks or zones from the GUI only.

audit_to_syslog_enable.description: If set to True, audit log messages are also copied to the syslog.

deny_mgm_snapshots.description: If set to True, the managed Grid will not send snapshots to the Multi-Grid Master.

dscp.description: The DSCP value. Valid values are integers between 0 and 63 inclusive.

enable_federation.description: Determines if the federation feature is enabled or not. Test Setting will be performed for any change in enable_federation.

enable_force_sync_join_token_to_gmc.description: Determines if the force sync join token from GM to GMC is enabled or not.

enable_gui_api_for_lan_vip.description: If set to True, GUI and API access are enabled on the LAN/VIP port and MGMT port (if configured).

enable_lom.description: Determines if the LOM functionality is enabled or not.

enable_member_redirect.description: Determines redirections is enabled or not for members.

enable_recycle_bin.description: Determines if the Recycle Bin is enabled or not.

enable_rir_swip.description: Determines if the RIR/SWIP support is enabled or not.

external_syslog_backup_servers.description: The list of external backup syslog servers.

external_syslog_server_enable.description: If set to True, external syslog servers are enabled.

is_grid_visualization_visible.description: If set to True, graphical visualization of the Grid is enabled.

mgm_strict_delegate_mode.description: Determines if strict delegate mode for the Grid managed by the Master Grid is enabled or not.

nat_groups.description: The list of all Network Address Translation (NAT) groups configured on the Grid.

restart_status.description: The restart status for the Grid.

rpz_hit_rate_interval.description: The time interval (in seconds) that determines how often the appliance calculates the RPZ hit rate.

rpz_hit_rate_max_query.description: The maximum number of incoming queries between the RPZ hit rate checks.

rpz_hit_rate_min_query.description: The minimum number of incoming queries between the RPZ hit rate checks.

secret.description: The shared secret of the Grid. This is a write-only attribute.

service_status.description: Determines overall service status of the Grid.

support_bundle_download_timeout.description: Support bundle download timeout in seconds.

syslog_facility.description: If 'audit_to_syslog_enable' is set to True, the facility that determines the processes and daemons from which the log messages are generated.

syslog_servers.description: The list of external syslog servers.

syslog_size.description: The maximum size for the syslog file expressed in megabytes.

threshold_traps.description: Determines the list of threshold traps. The user can only change the values for each trap or remove traps.

time_zone.description: The time zone of the Grid. The UTC string that represents the time zone, such as "US/Eastern".

token_usage_delay.description: The delayed usage (in minutes) of a permission token.

trap_notifications.description: Determines configuration of the trap notifications.

updates_download_member_config.description: The list of member configuration structures, which provides information and settings for configuring the member that is responsible for downloading updates.

traffic_capture_enable.description: Enable automated traffic capture based on monitoring thresholds.

destination.description: Destination of traffic capture files. Save traffic capture locally or upload to remote server using FTP or SCP.

duration.description: The time interval on which traffic will be captured(in sec).

include_support_bundle.description: Enable automatic download for support bundle.

destination_host.description: IP Address of the destination host.

traffic_capture_directory.description: Directory to store the traffic capture files on the remote server.

support_bundle_directory.description: Directory to store the support bundle on the remote server.

username.description: User name for accessing the FTP/SCP server.

password.description: Password for accessing the FTP/SCP server. This field is not readable.

enable.description: Determines whether the consent banner is enabled.

message.description: The message included in the consent banner.

username.description: The user name for the CspApiConfig.

csp_join_token.description: Join token required to connect to a cluster

csp_dns_resolver.description: IP address of DNS resolver in DFP

csp_https_proxy.description: HTTP Proxy IP address of CSP Portal

option_with_ea.description: This option describes which action must be taken if the extensible attribute exists for both the parent and descendant objects: * INHERIT: inherit the extensible attribute from the parent object. * RETAIN: retain the value of an extensible attribute that was set for the child object. * CONVERT: the value of the extensible attribute must be copied from the parent object.

option_without_ea.description: This option describes which action must be taken if the extensible attribute exists for the parent, but is absent from the descendant object: * INHERIT: inherit the extensible attribute from the parent object. * NOT_INHERIT: do nothing.

option_delete_ea.description: This option describes which action must be taken if the extensible attribute exists for the descendant, but is absent for the parent object: * RETAIN: retain the extensible attribute value for the descendant object. * REMOVE: remove this extensible attribute from the descendant object.

resolvers.description: The resolvers of a Grid member. The Grid member sends queries to the first name server address in the list. The second name server address is used if first one does not response.

search_domains.description: The Search Domain Group, which is a group of domain names that the Infoblox device can add to partial queries that do not specify a domain name. Note that you can set this parameter only when prefer_resolver or alternate_resolver is set.

enabled.description: Determines if email notification is enabled or not.

from_address.description: The email address of a Grid Member for 'from' field in notification.

address.description: The notification email address of a Grid member.

relay_enabled.description: Determines if email relay is enabled or not.

relay.description: The relay name or IP address.

address_or_fqdn.description: The IPv4 or IPv6 address or FQDN of the backup syslog server.

directory_path.description: The directory path for the replication of the rotated syslog files.

enable.description: If set to True, the syslog backup server is enabled.

password.description: The password of the backup syslog server.

port.description: The port used to connect to the backup syslog server.

protocol.description: The transport protocol used to connect to the backup syslog server.

username.description: The username of the backup syslog server.

address.description: The address of the HTTP proxy server.

port.description: The port on which the HTTP proxy server listens.

enable_proxy.description: Determines if the HTTP proxy server is enabled or not.

enable_content_inspection.description: Determines if HTTPS content inspection by the HTTP proxy server is enabled or not.

verify_cname.description: Determines if the CNAME record query verification is enabled or not.

comment.description: The descriptive comment for the HTTP proxy server configuration.

username.description: The user name for the HTTP proxy server.

password.description: The password for the HTTP proxy server.

certificate.description: The token returned by the uploadinit function call in object fileop for the CA certificate file used in the content inspection by an HTTP proxy server.

enable_username_and_password.description: Determines if username and password for HTTP Proxy Server connectivity is used or not.

enable.description: Determines whether the display of the informational level banner is enabled.

message.description: The message included in the informational level banner.

color.description: The color for the informational level banner.

enable_sequential_failed_login_attempts_.description: Enable/disable sequential failed login attempts lockout for local users

sequential_attempts.description: The number of failed login attempts

failed_lockout_duration.description: Time period the account remains locked after sequential failed login attempt lockout.

never_unlock_user.description: Never unlock option is also provided and if set then user account is locked forever and only super user can unlock this account

role.description: The LOM user role which specifies the list of actions that are allowed for the user.

disable.description: Determines whether the LOM user is disabled.

comment.description: The descriptive comment for the LOM user.

log_destination.description: The logging of synchronization messages to the syslog or mslog.

enable_invalid_mac.description: Determines if the invalid MAC address synchronization for DHCP leases and fixed addresses is enabled or not.

max_connection.description: Determines the maximum number of connections to Microsoft servers.

rpc_timeout.description: Determines the timeout value (in seconds) for RPC connections to all Microsoft servers.

enable_dhcp_monitoring.description: Determines if the monitoring and control of DHCP service on all Microsoft servers in the Grid is enabled or not.

enable_dns_monitoring.description: Determines if the monitoring and control of DNS service on all Microsoft servers in the Grid is enabled or not.

ldap_timeout.description: Determines an LDAP connection timeout interval (in seconds) for all Microsoft servers.

default_ip_site_link.description: The default IP site link for sites created on NIOS for all Microsoft servers.

enable_network_users.description: Determines if the Network Users creation is enabled or not.

enable_ad_user_sync.description: Determines if Active Directory user synchronization for all Microsoft servers in the Grid is enabled or not.

ad_user_default_timeout.description: Determines the default timeout value (in seconds) for Active Directory user synchronization for all Microsoft servers.

enable_dns_reports_sync.description: Determines if synchronization of DNS reporting data from all Microsoft servers in the Grid is enabled or not.

enable_ntp.description: Determines whether NTP is enabled on the Grid.

ntp_servers.description: The list of NTP servers configured on a Grid.

ntp_keys.description: The list of NTP authentication keys used to authenticate NTP clients.

ntp_kod.description: Determines whether the Kiss-o'-Death packets are enabled.

gm_local_ntp_stratum.description: Grid level GM local NTP stratum.

local_ntp_stratum.description: Local NTP stratum for non-GM members.

use_default_stratum.description: This flag controls whether gm_local_ntp_stratum value be set to a default value

address.description: The NTP server IP address or FQDN.

enable_authentication.description: Determines whether the NTP authentication is enabled.

preferred.description: Determines whether the NTP server is a preferred one or not.

burst.description: Determines whether the BURST operation mode is enabled. In BURST operating mode, when the external server is reachable and a valid source of synchronization is available, NTP sends a burst of 8 packets with a 2 second interval between packets.

iburst.description: Determines whether the IBURST operation mode is enabled. In IBURST operating mode, when the external server is unreachable, NTP server sends a burst of 8 packets with a 2 second interval between packets.

acl_type.description: The NTP access control list type.

ac_list.description: The list of NTP access control items.

service.description: The type of service with access control for the assigned named ACL.

address_ac.description: The client address/network with access control.

service.description: The type of service with access control.

address.description: The address this rule applies to or "Any".

permission.description: The permission to use for this address.

enable.description: Determines whether the objects changes tracking feature is enabled or not.

enable_completion.description: Determines the percentage of completion for objects changes tracking.

state.description: Determines the objects changes tracking enable state.

max_time_to_track.description: Maximum time period in seconds to track the deleted objects changes. You can enter a value from 7200 - 604800 seconds.

max_objs_to_track.description: Maximum number of deleted objects retained for tracking. You can enter a value from 2000 - 20000.

password_min_length.description: The minimum length of the password.

num_lower_char.description: The minimum number of lowercase characters.

num_upper_char.description: The minimum number of uppercase characters.

num_numeric_char.description: The minimum number of numeric characters.

num_symbol_char.description: The minimum number of symbol characters. The allowed characters are ! @ # $ % ^ & * ( ).

chars_to_change.description: The minimum number of characters that must be changed when revising an admin password.

expire_days.description: The number of days of the password expiration period (if enabled).

reminder_days.description: The number of days before the password expiration date when the appliance sends a reminder.

force_reset_enable.description: If set to True, all new users must change their passwords when they first log in to the system, and existing users must change the passwords that were just reset.

expire_enable.description: If set to True, password expiration is enabled.

num_passwords_saved.description: Number of saved passwords if password history is enabled. Can be set between 1 to 20.

min_password_age.description: Minimum password age in days before password can be updated. Can be set between 1 to 9998 days.

enabled.description: If set to True, the restart banner is enabled.

enable_double_confirmation.description: If set to True, the user is required to input name before restarting the services.

status.description: The status of the scheduled backup.

execute.description: The state for scheduled backup or restore operation.

backup_type.description: The destination of the backup files.

keep_local_copy.description: Determines whether the local backup performed before uploading backup to remote storage.

weekday.description: The day of the week when the backup is performed.

hour_of_day.description: The hour of the day past 12:00 AM the backup is performed.

minutes_past_hour.description: The minute of the hour when the backup is performed.

username.description: The user name on the backup server.

password.description: The user password on the backup server.

backup_server.description: The IP address of the backup server.

path.description: The directory path to the backup file stored on the server.

restore_type.description: The destination of the restore files.

restore_server.description: The IP address of the restore server.

restore_username.description: The user name on the restore server.

restore_password.description: The password on the restore server.

restore_path.description: The directory path to the restored file on the server.

nios_data.description: Determines whether the restore of the NIOS data is enabled.

discovery_data.description: Determines whether the restore the NetMRI data is enabled.

splunk_app_data.description: Determines whether the restore of the Splunk application data is enabled.

enable.description: Determines whether the scheduled backup is enabled.

use_keys.description: If set, scp backup support based on keys

key_type.description: If set, scp backup support based on keys type

upload_keys.description: If set, scp backup support to upload keys

download_keys.description: If set, scp backup support to download keys

message.description: The classification message to be displayed.

enable.description: If set to True, the security banner will be displayed on the header and footer of the Grid Manager screen, including the Login screen.

audit_log_rolling_enable.description: If set to True, rolling of audit logs is enabled.

admin_access_items.description: A list of access control settings used for security access.

http_redirect_enable.description: If set to True, HTTP connections are redirected to HTTPS.

login_banner_enable.description: If set to True, the login banner is enabled.

remote_console_access_enable.description: If set to True, superuser admins can access the Infoblox CLI from a remote location using an SSH (Secure Shell) v2 client.

security_access_enable.description: If set to True, HTTP access restrictions are enabled.

security_access_remote_console_enable.description: If set to True, remote console access restrictions will be enabled.

session_timeout.description: The session timeout interval in seconds.

ssh_perm_enable.description: If set to False, SSH access is permanently disabled.

support_access_enable.description: If set to True, support access for the Grid has been enabled.

support_access_info.description: Information string to be used for support access requests.

address.description: The address this rule applies to or "Any".

permission.description: The permission to use for this address.

tsig_key.description: A generated TSIG key. If the external primary server is a NIOS appliance running DNS One 2.x code, this can be set to :2xCOMPAT.

tsig_key_name.description: The name of the TSIG key. If 2.x TSIG compatibility is used, this is set to 'tsig_xfer' on retrieval, and ignored on insert or update.

inactive_days.description: Number of days after which account gets locked out if user does not login.

reminder_days.description: The number of days before the account lockout date when the appliance sends a reminder.

reactivate_via_serial_console_enable.description: Enable/disable reactivating user account by logging in from serial console.

reactivate_via_remote_console_enable.description: Enable/disable reactivating user account by logging in from remote console.

engine_id.description: The engine ID of the appliance that manages the SNMP agent.

queries_community_string.description: The community string for SNMP queries.

queries_enable.description: If set to True, SNMP queries are enabled.

snmpv3_queries_enable.description: If set to True, SNMPv3 queries are enabled.

snmpv3_queries_users.description: A list of SNMPv3 queries users.

snmpv3_traps_enable.description: If set to True, SNMPv3 traps are enabled.

syscontact.description: The name of the contact person for the appliance. Second value is applicable only for HA pair. Otherwise second value is ignored.

sysdescr.description: Useful information about the appliance. Second value is applicable only for HA pair. Otherwise second value is ignored.

syslocation.description: The physical location of the appliance. Second value is applicable only for HA pair. Otherwise second value is ignored.

sysname.description: The FQDN (Fully Qualified Domain Name) of the appliance. Second value is applicable only for HA pair. Otherwise second value is ignored.

traps_community_string.description: A string the NIOS appliance sends to the management system together with its traps. Note that this community string must match exactly what you enter in the management system.

traps_enable.description: If set to True, SNMP traps are enabled.

comment.description: A descriptive comment for this queries user.

address.description: The address of the trap receiver.

user.description: The SNMPv3 user for this trap receiver.

comment.description: A descriptive comment for this trap receiver.

certificate.description: Reference to the underlying X509Certificate object grid:x509certificate.

certificate_token.description: The token returned by the uploadinit function call in object fileop.

connection_type.description: The connection type for communicating with this server.

port.description: The port this server listens on.

local_interface.description: The local interface through which the appliance sends syslog messages to the syslog server.

message_source.description: The source of syslog messages to be sent to the external syslog server. If set to 'INTERNAL', only messages the appliance generates will be sent to the syslog server. If set to 'EXTERNAL', the appliance sends syslog messages that it receives from other devices, such as syslog servers and routers. If set to 'ANY', the appliance sends both internal and external syslog messages.

message_node_id.description: Identify the node in the syslog message.

severity.description: The severity filter. The appliance sends log messages of the specified severity and above to the external syslog server.

category_list.description: The list of all syslog logging categories.

only_category_list.description: The list of selected syslog logging categories. The appliance forwards syslog messages that belong to the selected categories.

trap_type.description: Determines the type of a given trap.

trap_reset.description: Determines the threshold value to reset the trap.

trap_trigger.description: Determines the threshold value to trigger the trap.

auth_dns_latency_trigger_enable.description: Enabling trigger automated traffic capture based on authoritative DNS latency.

auth_dns_latency_threshold.description: Authoritative DNS latency below which traffic capture will be triggered.

auth_dns_latency_reset.description: Authoritative DNS latency above which traffic capture will stopped.

auth_dns_latency_listen_on_source.description: The local IP DNS service is listen on (for authoritative DNS latency trigger).

chr_trigger_enable.description: Enable triggering automated traffic capture based on cache hit ratio thresholds.

chr_threshold.description: DNS Cache hit ratio threshold(%) below which traffic capture will be triggered.

chr_reset.description: DNS Cache hit ratio threshold(%) above which traffic capture will be triggered.

chr_min_cache_utilization.description: Minimum DNS cache utilization threshold(%) for triggering traffic capture based on DNS cache hit ratio.

qps_trigger_enable.description: Enable triggering automated traffic capture based on DNS queries per second threshold.

qps_threshold.description: DNS queries per second threshold below which traffic capture will be triggered.

qps_reset.description: DNS queries per second threshold below which traffic capture will be stopped.

rec_dns_latency_trigger_enable.description: Enable triggering automated traffic capture based on recursive DNS latency.

rec_dns_latency_threshold.description: Recursive DNS latency below which traffic capture will be triggered.

rec_dns_latency_reset.description: Recursive DNS latency above which traffic capture will be stopped.

rec_dns_latency_listen_on_source.description: The local IP DNS service is listen on ( for recursive DNS latency trigger).

kpi_monitored_domains.description: List of domains monitored by 'Recursive DNS Latency Threshold' trigger.

recursive_clients_count_trigger_enable.description: Enable triggering automated traffic capture based on outgoing recursive queries count.

recursive_clients_count_threshold.description: Concurrent outgoing recursive queries count below which traffic capture will be triggered.

recursive_clients_count_reset.description: Concurrent outgoing recursive queries count below which traffic capture will be stopped.

trap_type.description: Determines the type of a given trap.

enable_email.description: Determines if the email notifications for the given trap are enabled or not.

enable_trap.description: Determines if the trap is enabled or not.

member.description: The name of the updates download member.

interface.description: The source interface for updates download requests.

is_online.description: Determines if the updates download member is online or not.

enable_recycle_bin.description: Determines whether the recycle bin for deleted cloud objects is enabled or not on the Grid Master.

allocated_ip_count.description: Total number of IPs allocated by tenants.

available_ip_count.description: The total number of IP addresses available to tenants. Only IP addresses in networks that are within a delegation scope are counted.

fixed_ip_count.description: The total number of fixed IP addresses currently in use by all tenants in the system.

floating_ip_count.description: The total number of floating IP addresses currently in use by all tenants in the system.

created_ts.description: The timestamp when the tenant was first created in the system.

id.description: Unique ID associated with the tenant. This is set only when the tenant is first created.

last_event_ts.description: The timestamp when the last event associated with the tenant happened.

network_count.description: Number of Networks associated with the tenant.

vm_count.description: Number of VMs associated with the tenant.

delegated_member.description: The Cloud Platform Appliance to which authority of the object is delegated.

delegated_scope.description: Indicates the scope of delegation for the object. This can be one of the following: NONE (outside any delegation), ROOT (the delegation point), SUBTREE (within the scope of a delegation), RECLAIMING (within the scope of a delegation being reclaimed, either as the delegation point or in the subtree).

delegated_root.description: Indicates the root of the delegation if delegated_scope is SUBTREE or RECLAIMING. This is not set otherwise.

usage.description: Indicates the cloud origin of the object.

tenant.description: Reference to the tenant object associated with the object, if any.

authority.description: The Grid-level authority flag. This flag specifies whether a DHCP server is authoritative for a domain.

bootfile.description: The name of a file that DHCP clients need to boot. Some DHCP clients use BOOTP (bootstrap protocol) or include the boot file name option in their DHCPREQUEST messages.

bootserver.description: The name of the server on which a boot file is stored.

capture_hostname.description: The Grid-level capture hostname flag. Set this flag to capture the hostname and lease time when assigning a fixed address.

ddns_domainname.description: The member DDNS domain name value.

ddns_generate_hostname.description: Determines if the ability of a DHCP server to generate a host name and update DNS with this host name when it receives a DHCP REQUEST message that does not include a host name is enabled or not.

ddns_retry_interval.description: Determines the retry interval when the DHCP server makes repeated attempts to send DDNS updates to a DNS server.

ddns_server_always_updates.description: Determines that only the DHCP server is allowed to update DNS, regardless of the requests from the DHCP clients.

ddns_ttl.description: The DDNS TTL (Dynamic DNS Time To Live) value specifies the number of seconds an IP address for the name is cached.

ddns_update_fixed_addresses.description: Determines if the Grid DHCP server's ability to update the A and PTR records with a fixed address is enabled or not.

ddns_use_option81.description: Determines if support for option 81 is enabled or not.

deny_bootp.description: Determines if deny BOOTP is enabled or not.

disable_all_nac_filters.description: If set to True, NAC filters will be disabled on the Infoblox Grid.

dns_update_style.description: The update style for dynamic DNS updates.

email_list.description: The Grid-level email_list value. Specify an e-mail address to which you want the Infoblox appliance to send e-mail notifications when the DHCP address usage for the grid crosses a threshold. You can create a list of several e-mail addresses.

enable_ddns.description: Determines if the member DHCP server's ability to send DDNS updates is enabled or not.

enable_dhcp_thresholds.description: Represents the watermarks above or below which address usage in a network is unexpected and might warrant your attention.

enable_email_warnings.description: Determines if e-mail warnings are enabled or disabled. When DHCP threshold is enabled and DHCP address usage crosses a watermark threshold, the appliance sends an e-mail notification to an administrator.

enable_fingerprint.description: Determines if the fingerprint feature is enabled or not. If you enable this feature, the server will match a fingerprint for incoming lease requests.

enable_gss_tsig.description: Determines whether all appliances are enabled to receive GSS-TSIG authenticated updates from DHCP clients.

enable_hostname_rewrite.description: Determines if the Grid-level host name rewrite feature is enabled or not.

enable_leasequery.description: Determines if lease query is allowed or not.

enable_roaming_hosts.description: Determines if DHCP servers in a Grid support roaming hosts or not.

enable_snmp_warnings.description: Determined if the SNMP warnings on Grid-level are enabled or not. When DHCP threshold is enabled and DHCP address usage crosses a watermark threshold, the appliance sends an SNMP trap to the trap receiver that you defined you defined at the Grid member level.

format_log_option_82.description: The format option for Option 82 logging.

grid.description: Determines the Grid that serves DHCP. This specifies a group of Infoblox appliances that are connected together to provide a single point of device administration and service configuration in a secure, highly available environment.

gss_tsig_keys.description: The list of GSS-TSIG keys for a Grid DHCP object.

high_water_mark.description: Determines the high watermark value of a Grid DHCP server. If the percentage of allocated addresses exceeds this watermark, the appliance makes a syslog entry and sends an e-mail notification (if enabled). Specifies the percentage of allocated addresses. The range is from 1 to 100.

high_water_mark_reset.description: Determines the high watermark reset value of a member DHCP server. If the percentage of allocated addresses drops below this value, a corresponding SNMP trap is reset. Specifies the percentage of allocated addresses. The range is from 1 to 100. The high watermark reset value must be lower than the high watermark value.

hostname_rewrite_policy.description: The name of the default hostname rewrite policy, which is also in the protocol_hostname_rewrite_policies array.

ignore_dhcp_option_list_request.description: Determines if the ignore DHCP option list request flag of a Grid DHCP is enabled or not. If this flag is set to true all available DHCP options will be returned to the client.

ignore_id.description: Indicates whether the appliance will ignore DHCP client IDs or MAC addresses. Valid values are "NONE", "CLIENT", or "MACADDR". The default is "NONE".

ignore_mac_addresses.description: A list of MAC addresses the appliance will ignore.

immediate_fa_configuration.description: Determines if the fixed address configuration takes effect immediately without DHCP service restart or not.

ipv6_capture_hostname.description: Determines if the IPv6 host name and lease time is captured or not while assigning a fixed address.

ipv6_ddns_domainname.description: The Grid-level DDNS domain name value.

ipv6_ddns_enable_option_fqdn.description: Controls whether the FQDN option sent by the client is to be used, or if the server can automatically generate the FQDN.

ipv6_ddns_server_always_updates.description: Determines if the server always updates DNS or updates only if requested by the client.

ipv6_ddns_ttl.description: The Grid-level IPv6 DDNS TTL value.

ipv6_dns_update_style.description: The update style for dynamic DHCPv6 DNS updates.

ipv6_domain_name_servers.description: The comma separated list of domain name server addresses in IPv6 address format.

ipv6_enable_ddns.description: Determines if sending DDNS updates by the DHCPv6 server is enabled or not.

ipv6_enable_gss_tsig.description: Determines whether the all appliances are enabled to receive GSS-TSIG authenticated updates from DHCPv6 clients.

ipv6_enable_lease_scavenging.description: Indicates whether DHCPv6 lease scavenging is enabled or disabled.

ipv6_enable_retry_updates.description: Determines if the DHCPv6 server retries failed dynamic DNS updates or not.

ipv6_generate_hostname.description: Determines if the server generates the hostname if it is not sent by the client.

ipv6_gss_tsig_keys.description: The list of GSS-TSIG keys for a Grid DHCPv6 object.

ipv6_kdc_server.description: The IPv6 address or FQDN of the Kerberos server for DHCPv6 GSS-TSIG authentication.

ipv6_lease_scavenging_time.description: The Grid-level grace period (in seconds) to keep an expired lease before it is deleted by the scavenging process.

ipv6_microsoft_code_page.description: The Grid-level Microsoft client DHCP IPv6 code page value. This value is the hostname translation code page for Microsoft DHCP IPv6 clients.

ipv6_options.description: An array of DHCP option dhcpoption structs that lists the DHCPv6 options associated with the object.

ipv6_prefixes.description: The Grid-level list of IPv6 prefixes.

ipv6_recycle_leases.description: Determines if the IPv6 recycle leases feature is enabled or not. If the feature is enabled, leases are kept in the Recycle Bin until one week after expiration. When the feature is disabled, the leases are irrecoverably deleted.

ipv6_remember_expired_client_association.description: Enable binding for expired DHCPv6 leases.

ipv6_retry_updates_interval.description: Determines the retry interval when the member DHCPv6 server makes repeated attempts to send DDNS updates to a DNS server.

ipv6_txt_record_handling.description: The Grid-level TXT record handling value. This value specifies how DHCPv6 should treat the TXT records when performing DNS updates.

ipv6_update_dns_on_lease_renewal.description: Controls whether the DHCPv6 server updates DNS when an IPv6 DHCP lease is renewed.

kdc_server.description: The IPv4 address or FQDN of the Kerberos server for DHCPv4 GSS-TSIG authentication.

lease_logging_member.description: The Grid member on which you want to store the DHCP lease history log. Infoblox recommends that you dedicate a member other than the master as a logging member. If possible, use this member solely for storing the DHCP lease history log. If you do not select a member, no logging can occur.

lease_per_client_settings.description: Defines how the appliance releases DHCP leases. Valid values are "RELEASE_MACHING_ID", "NEVER_RELEASE", or "ONE_LEASE_PER_CLIENT". The default is "RELEASE_MATCHING_ID".

lease_scavenge_time.description: Determines the lease scavenging time value. When this field is set, the appliance permanently deletes the free and backup leases, that remain in the database beyond a specified period of time. To disable lease scavenging, set the parameter to -1. The minimum positive value must be greater than 86400 seconds (1 day).

log_lease_events.description: This value specifies whether the Grid DHCP members log lease events is enabled or not.

logic_filter_rules.description: This field contains the logic filters to be applied on the Infoblox Grid. This list corresponds to the match rules that are written to the dhcpd configuration file.

low_water_mark.description: Determines the low watermark value. If the percent of allocated addresses drops below this watermark, the appliance makes a syslog entry and if enabled, sends an e-mail notification.

low_water_mark_reset.description: Determines the low watermark reset value.If the percentage of allocated addresses exceeds this value, a corresponding SNMP trap is reset. A number that specifies the percentage of allocated addresses. The range is from 1 to 100. The low watermark reset value must be higher than the low watermark value.

microsoft_code_page.description: The Microsoft client DHCP IPv4 code page value of a Grid. This value is the hostname translation code page for Microsoft DHCP IPv4 clients.

nextserver.description: The next server value of a DHCP server. This value is the IP address or name of the boot file server on which the boot file is stored.

option60_match_rules.description: The list of option 60 match rules.

options.description: An array of DHCP option dhcpoption structs that lists the DHCP options associated with the object. Note that WAPI does not return special options 'routers', 'domain-name-servers', 'domain-name' and 'broadcast-address' with empty values for this object.

ping_count.description: Specifies the number of pings that the Infoblox appliance sends to an IP address to verify that it is not in use. Values are range is from 0 to 10, where 0 disables pings.

ping_timeout.description: Indicates the number of milliseconds the appliance waits for a response to its ping. Valid values are 100, 500, 1000, 2000, 3000, 4000 and 5000 milliseconds.

prefix_length_mode.description: The Prefix length mode for DHCPv6.

protocol_hostname_rewrite_policies.description: The list of hostname rewrite policies.

pxe_lease_time.description: Specifies the duration of time it takes a host to connect to a boot server, such as a TFTP server, and download the file it needs to boot. A 32-bit unsigned integer that represents the duration, in seconds, for which the update is cached. Zero indicates that the update is not cached.

recycle_leases.description: Determines if the recycle leases feature is enabled or not. If you enabled this feature, and then delete a DHCP range, the appliance stores active leases from this range up to one week after the leases expires.

retry_ddns_updates.description: Indicates whether the DHCP server makes repeated attempts to send DDNS updates to a DNS server.

syslog_facility.description: The syslog facility is the location on the syslog server to which you want to sort the syslog messages.

txt_record_handling.description: The Grid-level TXT record handling value. This value specifies how DHCP should treat the TXT records when performing DNS updates.

update_dns_on_lease_renewal.description: Controls whether the DHCP server updates DNS when a DHCP lease is renewed.

valid_lifetime.description: The valid lifetime for the Grid members.

num.description: The code of the DHCP option.

vendor_class.description: The name of the space this DHCP option is associated to.

use_option.description: Only applies to special options that are displayed separately from other options and have a use flag. These options are: * routers * router-templates * domain-name-servers * domain-name * broadcast-address * broadcast-address-offset * dhcp-lease-time * dhcp6.name-servers

type.description: The filter type. Valid values are: * MAC * NAC * Option

match_value.description: The match value for this DHCP Option 60 match rule.

option_space.description: The option space for this DHCP Option 60 match rule.

is_substring.description: Determines if the match value is a substring.

substring_offset.description: The offset of match value for this DHCP Option 60 match rule.

substring_length.description: The length of match value for this DHCP Option 60 match rule.

num.description: The code of the DHCP option.

vendor_class.description: The name of the space this DHCP option is associated to.

use_option.description: Only applies to special options that are displayed separately from other options and have a use flag. These options are: * routers * router-templates * domain-name-servers * domain-name * broadcast-address * broadcast-address-offset * dhcp-lease-time * dhcp6.name-servers

delay.description: The time duration to delay a restart for a restart group.

timeout.description: The duration of timeout for a restart group. The value "-1" means infinite.

restart_offline.description: Determines whether the Grid should try to restart offline member.

comment.description: Comment for the Restart Group; maximum 256 characters.

extattrs.description: Extensible attributes associated with the object. For valid values for extensible attributes, see {extattrs:values}.

is_default.description: Determines if this Restart Group is the default group.

last_updated_time.description: The timestamp when the status of the latest request has changed.

members.description: The list of members belonging to the group.

mode.description: The default restart method for this Restart Group.

name.description: The name of this Restart Group.

requests.description: The list of requests associated with a restart group.

service.description: The applicable service for this Restart Group.

status.description: The restart status for a restart group.

services.description: The list of applicable services for the restart.

mode.description: The restart method for a Grid restart.

schedule.description: The Schedule Setting struct that determines the schedule for the restart.

force.description: Determines if the Restart Group should have a force restart.

weekdays.description: Days of the week when scheduling is triggered.

time_zone.description: The time zone for the schedule.

recurring_time.description: The recurring time for the schedule in Epoch seconds format. This field is obsolete and is preserved only for backward compatibility purposes. Please use other applicable fields to define the recurring schedule. DO NOT use recurring_time together with these fields. If you use recurring_time with other fields to define the recurring schedule, recurring_time has priority over year, hour_of_day, and minutes_past_hour and will override the values of these fields, although it does not override month and day_of_month. In this case, the recurring time value might be different than the intended value that you define.

frequency.description: The frequency for the scheduled task.

every.description: The number of frequency to wait before repeating the scheduled task.

minutes_past_hour.description: The minutes past the hour for the scheduled task.

hour_of_day.description: The hour of day for the scheduled task.

year.description: The year for the scheduled task.

month.description: The month for the scheduled task.

day_of_month.description: The day of the month for the scheduled task.

repeat.description: Indicates if the scheduled task will be repeated or run only once.

disable.description: If set to True, the scheduled task is disabled.

no_restart.description: The number of requests that did not require a restart.

parent.description: A reference to the grid or grid:servicerestart:group object associated with the request.

pending.description: The number of requests that are pending a restart.

pending_restart.description: The number of forced or needed requests pending for restart.

processing.description: The number of not forced and not needed requests pending for restart.

restarting.description: The number of service restarts for corresponding members.

success.description: The number of requests associated with successful restarts.

forced.description: Indicates if this is a force restart.

address.description: IP Address or FQDN to use to contact the SGM

connection_disabled.description: Indicates whether the sub-grid is currently disabled (true) or not (false).

connection_timestamp.description: Timestamp of the beginning of the current VPN connection with the SGM.

detached.description: Indicate detached state of subgrid with MGM.

join_status.description: Gives the overall status of the Super Grid connectivity

join_token_expiration.description: Timestamp when the sub grid join token expires.

joined.description: Indicates whether the sub-grid is currently joined or not.

last_event.description: Last event notified by the Super Grid Master.

last_sync_timestamp.description: Timestamp of the last synchronization with the SGM.

port.description: Alternate port number to use when connecting to the VPN endpoint.

use_mgmt_port.description: Indicates whether to use the management port to connect to the SGM.

analytics_tunneling_event_critical_thres.description: The Grid Dashboard critical threshold for Analytics tunneling events.

analytics_tunneling_event_warning_thresh.description: The Grid Dashboard warning threshold for Analytics tunneling events.

atp_critical_event_critical_threshold.description: The Grid Dashboard critical threshold for ATP critical events.

atp_critical_event_warning_threshold.description: The Grid Dashboard warning threshold for ATP critical events.

atp_major_event_critical_threshold.description: The Grid Dashboard critical threshold for ATP major events.

atp_major_event_warning_threshold.description: The Grid Dashboard warning threshold for ATP major events.

atp_warning_event_critical_threshold.description: The Grid Dashboard critical threshold for ATP warning events.

atp_warning_event_warning_threshold.description: The Grid Dashboard warning threshold for ATP warning events.

rpz_blocked_hit_critical_threshold.description: The critical threshold value for blocked RPZ hits in the Grid dashboard.

rpz_blocked_hit_warning_threshold.description: The warning threshold value for blocked RPZ hits in the Grid dashboard.

rpz_passthru_event_critical_threshold.description: The Grid Dashboard critical threshold for RPZ passthru events.

rpz_passthru_event_warning_threshold.description: The Grid Dashboard warning threshold for RPZ passthru events.

rpz_substituted_hit_critical_threshold.description: The critical threshold value for substituted RPZ hits in the Grid dashboard.

rpz_substituted_hit_warning_threshold.description: The warning threshold value for substituted RPZ hits in the Grid dashboard.

add_client_ip_mac_options.description: Add custom IP, MAC and DNS View name ENDS0 options to outgoing recursive queries.

allow_bulkhost_ddns.description: Determines if DDNS bulk host is allowed or not.

allow_gss_tsig_zone_updates.description: Determines whether GSS-TSIG zone update is enabled for all Grid members.

allow_query.description: Determines if queries from the specified IPv4 or IPv6 addresses and networks are allowed or not. The appliance can also use Transaction Signature (TSIG) keys to authenticate the queries.

allow_recursive_query.description: Determines if the responses to recursive queries are enabled or not.

allow_transfer.description: Determines if zone transfers from specified IPv4 or IPv6 addresses and networks or transfers from hosts authenticated by Transaction signature (TSIG) key are allowed or not.

allow_update.description: Determines if dynamic updates from specified IPv4 or IPv6 addresses, networks or from host authenticated by TSIG key are allowed or not.

anonymize_response_logging.description: Determines if the anonymization of captured DNS responses is enabled or disabled.

bind_check_names_policy.description: The BIND check names policy, which indicates the action the appliance takes when it encounters host names that do not comply with the Strict Hostname Checking policy. This method applies only if the host name restriction policy is set to "Strict Hostname Checking".

bind_hostname_directive.description: The value of the hostname directive for BIND.

blackhole_list.description: The list of IPv4 or IPv6 addresses and networks from which DNS queries are blocked.

blacklist_action.description: The action to perform when a domain name matches the pattern defined in a rule that is specified by the blacklist ruleset.

blacklist_log_query.description: Determines if blacklist redirection queries are logged or not.

blacklist_redirect_addresses.description: The IP addresses the appliance includes in the response it sends in place of a blacklisted IP address.

blacklist_redirect_ttl.description: The TTL value (in seconds) of the synthetic DNS responses that result from blacklist redirection.

blacklist_rulesets.description: The DNS Ruleset object names assigned at the Grid level for blacklist redirection.

bulk_host_name_templates.description: The list of bulk host name templates. There are four Infoblox predefined bulk host name templates. Template Name Template Format "Four Octets" -$1-$2-$3-$4 "Three Octets" -$2-$3-$4 "Two Octets" -$3-$4 "One Octet" -$4

capture_dns_queries_on_all_domains.description: Determines if the capture of DNS queries for all domains is enabled or disabled.

check_names_for_ddns_and_zone_transfer.description: Determines whether the application of BIND check-names for zone transfers and DDNS updates are enabled.

client_subnet_domains.description: The list of zone domain names that are allowed or forbidden for EDNS client subnet (ECS) recursion.

client_subnet_ipv4_prefix_length.description: Default IPv4 Source Prefix-Length used when sending queries with EDNS client subnet option.

client_subnet_ipv6_prefix_length.description: Default IPv6 Source Prefix-Length used when sending queries with EDNS client subnet option.

copy_client_ip_mac_options.description: Copy custom IP, MAC and DNS View name ENDS0 options from incoming to outgoing recursive queries.

copy_xfer_to_notify.description: The allowed IPs, from the zone transfer list, added to the also-notify statement in the named.conf file.

custom_root_name_servers.description: The list of customized root nameserver(s). You can use Internet root name servers or specify host names and IP addresses of custom root name servers.

ddns_force_creation_timestamp_update.description: Defines whether creation timestamp of RR should be updated ' when DDNS update happens even if there is no change to ' the RR.

ddns_principal_group.description: The DDNS Principal cluster group name.

ddns_principal_tracking.description: Determines if the DDNS principal track is enabled or disabled.

ddns_restrict_patterns.description: Determines if an option to restrict DDNS update request based on FQDN patterns is enabled or disabled.

ddns_restrict_patterns_list.description: The unordered list of restriction patterns for an option of to restrict DDNS updates based on FQDN patterns.

ddns_restrict_protected.description: Determines if an option to restrict DDNS update request to protected resource records is enabled or disabled.

ddns_restrict_secure.description: Determines if DDNS update request for principal other than target resource record's principal is restricted.

ddns_restrict_static.description: Determines if an option to restrict DDNS update request to resource records which are marked as 'STATIC' is enabled or disabled.

default_bulk_host_name_template.description: Default bulk host name of a Grid DNS.

default_ttl.description: The default TTL value of a Grid DNS object. This interval tells the secondary how long the data can be cached.

disable_edns.description: Determines if the EDNS0 support for queries that require recursive resolution on Grid members is enabled or not.

dns64_groups.description: The list of DNS64 synthesis groups associated with this Grid DNS object.

dns_cache_acceleration_ttl.description: The minimum TTL value, in seconds, that a DNS record must have in order for it to be cached by the DNS Cache Acceleration service. An integer from 1 to 65000 that represents the TTL in seconds.

dns_health_check_anycast_control.description: Determines if the anycast failure (BFD session down) is enabled on member failure or not.

dns_health_check_domain_list.description: The list of domain names for the DNS health check.

dns_health_check_interval.description: The time interval (in seconds) for DNS health check.

dns_health_check_recursion_flag.description: Determines if the recursive DNS health check is enabled or not.

dns_health_check_retries.description: The number of DNS health check retries.

dns_health_check_timeout.description: The DNS health check timeout interval (in seconds).

dns_query_capture_file_time_limit.description: The time limit (in minutes) for the DNS query capture file.

dnssec_blacklist_enabled.description: Determines if the blacklist rules for DNSSEC-enabled clients are enabled or not.

dnssec_dns64_enabled.description: Determines if the DNS64 groups for DNSSEC-enabled clients are enabled or not.

dnssec_enabled.description: Determines if the DNS security extension is enabled or not.

dnssec_expired_signatures_enabled.description: Determines when the DNS member accepts expired signatures.

dnssec_negative_trust_anchors.description: A list of zones for which the server does not perform DNSSEC validation.

dnssec_nxdomain_enabled.description: Determines if the NXDOMAIN rules for DNSSEC-enabled clients are enabled or not.

dnssec_rpz_enabled.description: Determines if the RPZ policies for DNSSEC-enabled clients are enabled or not.

dnssec_trusted_keys.description: The list of trusted keys for the DNSSEC feature.

dnssec_validation_enabled.description: Determines if the DNS security validation is enabled or not.

domains_to_capture_dns_queries.description: The list of domains for DNS query capture.

dtc_dns_queries_specific_behavior.description: Setting to control specific behavior for DTC DNS responses for incoming lbdn matched queries.

dtc_edns_prefer_client_subnet.description: Determines whether to prefer the client address from the edns-client-subnet option for DTC or not.

dtc_topology_ea_list.description: The DTC topology extensible attribute definition list. When configuring a DTC topology, users may configure classification as either "Geographic" or "Extensible Attributes". Selecting extensible attributes will replace supported Topology database labels (Continent, Country, Subdivision, City) with the names of the selection EA types and provide values extracted from DHCP Network Container, Network and Range objects with those extensible attributes.

edns_udp_size.description: Advertises the EDNS0 buffer size to the upstream server. The value should be between 512 and 4096 bytes. The recommended value is between 512 and 1220 bytes.

email.description: The email address of a Grid DNS object.

enable_blackhole.description: Determines if the blocking of DNS queries is enabled or not.

enable_blacklist.description: Determines if a blacklist is enabled or not.

enable_capture_dns_queries.description: Determines if the capture of DNS queries is enabled or disabled.

enable_capture_dns_responses.description: Determines if the capture of DNS responses is enabled or disabled.

enable_client_subnet_forwarding.description: Determines whether to enable forwarding EDNS client subnet options to upstream servers.

enable_client_subnet_recursive.description: Determines whether to enable adding EDNS client subnet options in recursive resolution. The client_subnet_domains parameter value must not be empty to enable the enable_client_subnet_recursive parameter.

enable_delete_associated_ptr.description: Determines if the ability to automatically remove associated PTR records while deleting A or AAAA records is enabled or not.

enable_dns64.description: Determines if the DNS64 support is enabled or not.

enable_dns_health_check.description: Determines if the DNS health check is enabled or not.

enable_dnstap_queries.description: Determines whether the query messages need to be forwarded to DNSTAP or not.

enable_dnstap_responses.description: Determines whether the response messages need to be forwarded to DNSTAP or not.

enable_dnstap_violations_tls.description: Determines whether the violations messages need to be forwarded to DNSTAP or not.

enable_excluded_domain_names.description: Determines if excluding domain names from captured DNS queries and responses is enabled or disabled.

enable_fixed_rrset_order_fqdns.description: Determines if the fixed RRset order FQDN is enabled or not.

enable_ftc.description: Determines whether Fault Tolerant Caching (FTC) is enabled.

enable_gss_tsig.description: Determines whether all appliances in the Grid are enabled to receive GSS-TSIG authenticated updates from DNS clients.

enable_host_rrset_order.description: Determines if the host RRset order is enabled or not.

enable_hsm_signing.description: Determines whether Hardware Security Modules (HSMs) are enabled for key generation and signing. Note, that you must configure the HSM group with at least one enabled HSM.

enable_notify_source_port.description: Determines if the notify source port at the Grid Level is enabled or not.

enable_query_rewrite.description: Determines if the DNS query rewrite is enabled or not.

enable_query_source_port.description: Determines if the query source port at the Grid Level is enabled or not.

excluded_domain_names.description: The list of domains that are excluded from DNS query and response capture.

expire_after.description: The expiration time of a Grid DNS object. If the secondary DNS server fails to contact the primary server for the specified interval, the secondary server stops giving out answers about the zone because the zone data is too old to be useful.

filter_aaaa.description: The type of AAAA filtering for this member DNS object.

filter_aaaa_list.description: The list of IPv4 addresses and networks from which queries are received. AAAA filtering is applied to these addresses.

fixed_rrset_order_fqdns.description: The fixed RRset order FQDN. If this field does not contain an empty value, the appliance will automatically set the enable_fixed_rrset_order_fqdns field to 'true', unless the same request sets the enable field to 'false'.

forward_only.description: Determines if member sends queries to forwarders only. When the value is "true", the member sends queries to forwarders only, and not to other internal or Internet root servers.

forward_updates.description: Determines if secondary servers is allowed to forward updates to the DNS server or not.

forwarders.description: The forwarders for the member. A forwarder is essentially a name server to which other name servers first send all of their off-site queries. The forwarder builds up a cache of information, avoiding the need for the other name servers to send queries off-site.

ftc_expired_record_timeout.description: The timeout interval (in seconds) after which the expired Fault Tolerant Caching (FTC)record is stale and no longer valid.

ftc_expired_record_ttl.description: The TTL value (in seconds) of the expired Fault Tolerant Caching (FTC) record in DNS responses.

gen_eadb_from_hosts.description: Flag for taking EA values from IPAM Hosts into consideration for the DTC topology EA database.

gen_eadb_from_network_containers.description: Flag for taking EA values from IPAM Network Containers into consideration for the DTC topology EA database.

gen_eadb_from_networks.description: Flag for taking EA values from IPAM Network into consideration for the DTC topology EA database.

gen_eadb_from_ranges.description: Flag for taking EA values from IPAM Ranges into consideration for the DTC topology EA database.

gss_tsig_keys.description: The list of GSS-TSIG keys for a Grid DNS object.

last_queried_acl.description: Determines last queried ACL for the specified IPv4 or IPv6 addresses and networks in scavenging settings.

max_cache_ttl.description: The maximum time (in seconds) for which the server will cache positive answers.

max_cached_lifetime.description: The maximum time (in seconds) a DNS response can be stored in the hardware acceleration cache. Valid values are unsigned integer between 60 and 86400, inclusive.

max_ncache_ttl.description: The maximum time (in seconds) for which the server will cache negative (NXDOMAIN) responses. The maximum allowed value is 604800.

max_udp_size.description: The value is used by authoritative DNS servers to never send DNS responses larger than the configured value. The value should be between 512 and 4096 bytes. The recommended value is between 512 and 1220 bytes.

member_secondary_notify.description: Determines if Grid members that are authoritative secondary servers are allowed to send notification messages to external name servers, if the Grid member that is primary for a zone fails or loses connectivity.

negative_ttl.description: The negative TTL value of a Grid DNS object. This interval tells the secondary how long data can be cached for "Does Not Respond" responses.

notify_delay.description: Specifies with how many seconds of delay the notify messages are sent to secondaries.

notify_source_port.description: The source port for notify messages. When requesting zone transfers from the primary server, some secondary DNS servers use the source port number (the primary server used to send the notify message) as the destination port number in the zone transfer request. Valid values are between 1 and 63999. The default is picked by BIND.

nsgroups.description: A name server group is a collection of one primary DNS server and one or more secondary DNS servers.

nxdomain_log_query.description: Determines if NXDOMAIN redirection queries are logged or not.

nxdomain_redirect.description: Determines if NXDOMAIN redirection is enabled or not.

nxdomain_redirect_addresses.description: The list of IPv4 NXDOMAIN redirection addresses.

nxdomain_redirect_addresses_v6.description: The list of IPv6 NXDOMAIN redirection addresses.

nxdomain_redirect_ttl.description: The TTL value (in seconds) of synthetic DNS responses that result from NXDOMAIN redirection.

nxdomain_rulesets.description: The Ruleset object names assigned at the Grid level for NXDOMAIN redirection.

preserve_host_rrset_order_on_secondaries.description: Determines if the host RRset order on secondaries is preserved or not.

protocol_record_name_policies.description: The list of record name policies.

query_rewrite_domain_names.description: The list of domain names that trigger DNS query rewrite.

query_rewrite_prefix.description: The domain name prefix for DNS query rewrite.

query_source_port.description: The source port for queries. Specifying a source port number for recursive queries ensures that a firewall will allow the response. Valid values are between 1 and 63999. The default is picked by BIND.

recursive_query_list.description: The list of IPv4 or IPv6 addresses, networks or hosts authenticated by Transaction signature (TSIG) key from which recursive queries are allowed or denied.

refresh_timer.description: The refresh time. This interval tells the secondary how often to send a message to the primary for a zone to check that its data is current, and retrieve fresh data if it is not.

resolver_query_timeout.description: The recursive query timeout for the member.

retry_timer.description: The retry time. This interval tells the secondary how long to wait before attempting to recontact the primary after a connection failure occurs between the two servers.

root_name_server_type.description: Determines the type of root name servers.

lan_subnet_mask.description: LAN netmask only for GCP HA.

lan_gateway.description: LAN gateway only for GCP HA.

enable.description: If set to True, the member receives syslog messages from specified devices, such as syslog servers and routers, and then forwards these messages to an external syslog server.

tcp_enable.description: If set to True, the appliance can receive messages from other devices via TCP.

tcp_port.description: The TCP port the appliance must listen on.

udp_enable.description: If set to True, the appliance can receive messages from other devices via UDP.

udp_port.description: The UDP port the appliance must listen on.

client_acls.description: This list controls the IP addresses and networks that are allowed to access the syslog proxy.

address.description: The address this rule applies to or "Any".

permission.description: The permission to use for this address.

tsig_key.description: A generated TSIG key. If the external primary server is a NIOS appliance running DNS One 2.x code, this can be set to :2xCOMPAT.

tsig_key_name.description: The name of the TSIG key. If 2.x TSIG compatibility is used, this is set to 'tsig_xfer' on retrieval, and ignored on insert or update.

certificate.description: Reference to the underlying X509Certificate object grid:x509certificate.

certificate_token.description: The token returned by the uploadinit function call in object fileop.

connection_type.description: The connection type for communicating with this server.

port.description: The port this server listens on.

local_interface.description: The local interface through which the appliance sends syslog messages to the syslog server.

message_source.description: The source of syslog messages to be sent to the external syslog server. If set to 'INTERNAL', only messages the appliance generates will be sent to the syslog server. If set to 'EXTERNAL', the appliance sends syslog messages that it receives from other devices, such as syslog servers and routers. If set to 'ANY', the appliance sends both internal and external syslog messages.

message_node_id.description: Identify the node in the syslog message.

severity.description: The severity filter. The appliance sends log messages of the specified severity and above to the external syslog server.

category_list.description: The list of all syslog logging categories.

only_category_list.description: The list of selected syslog logging categories. The appliance forwards syslog messages that belong to the selected categories.

trap_type.description: Determines the type of a given trap.

trap_reset.description: Determines the threshold value to reset the trap.

trap_trigger.description: Determines the threshold value to trigger the trap.

auth_dns_latency_trigger_enable.description: Enabling trigger automated traffic capture based on authoritative DNS latency.

auth_dns_latency_threshold.description: Authoritative DNS latency below which traffic capture will be triggered.

auth_dns_latency_reset.description: Authoritative DNS latency above which traffic capture will stopped.

auth_dns_latency_listen_on_source.description: The local IP DNS service is listen on (for authoritative DNS latency trigger).

auth_dns_latency_listen_on_ip.description: The DNS listen-on IP address used if auth_dns_latency_on_source is IP.

chr_trigger_enable.description: Enable triggering automated traffic capture based on cache hit ratio thresholds.

chr_threshold.description: DNS Cache hit ratio threshold(%) below which traffic capture will be triggered.

chr_reset.description: DNS Cache hit ratio threshold(%) above which traffic capture will be triggered.

chr_min_cache_utilization.description: Minimum DNS cache utilization threshold(%) for triggering traffic capture based on DNS cache hit ratio.

qps_trigger_enable.description: Enable triggering automated traffic capture based on DNS queries per second threshold.

qps_threshold.description: DNS queries per second threshold below which traffic capture will be triggered.

qps_reset.description: DNS queries per second threshold below which traffic capture will be stopped.

rec_dns_latency_trigger_enable.description: Enable triggering automated traffic capture based on recursive DNS latency.

rec_dns_latency_threshold.description: Recursive DNS latency below which traffic capture will be triggered.

rec_dns_latency_reset.description: Recursive DNS latency above which traffic capture will be stopped.

rec_dns_latency_listen_on_source.description: The local IP DNS service is listen on ( for recursive DNS latency trigger).

rec_dns_latency_listen_on_ip.description: The DNS listen-on IP address used if rec_dns_latency_listen_on_source is IP.

kpi_monitored_domains.description: List of domains monitored by 'Recursive DNS Latency Threshold' trigger.

recursive_clients_count_trigger_enable.description: Enable triggering automated traffic capture based on outgoing recursive queries count.

recursive_clients_count_threshold.description: Concurrent outgoing recursive queries count below which traffic capture will be triggered.

recursive_clients_count_reset.description: Concurrent outgoing recursive queries count below which traffic capture will be stopped.

trap_type.description: Determines the type of a given trap.

enable_email.description: Determines if the email notifications for the given trap are enabled or not.

enable_trap.description: Determines if the trap is enabled or not.

address.description: The IPv4 Address of the Grid Member.

gateway.description: The default gateway for the Grid Member.

subnet_mask.description: The subnet mask for the Grid Member.

vlan_id.description: The identifier for the VLAN. Valid values are from 1 to 4096.

primary.description: Determines if the current address is the primary VLAN address or not.

dscp.description: The DSCP (Differentiated Services Code Point) value determines relative priorities for the type of services on your network. The appliance implements QoS (Quality of Service) rules based on this configuration. Valid values are from 0 to 63.

lan_subnet_mask.description: LAN netmask only for GCP HA.

lan_gateway.description: LAN gateway only for GCP HA.
