auth_server_group.description: The Authentication Server Group object associated with this member.

authn_captive_portal.description: The captive portal responsible for authenticating this DHCP member.

authn_captive_portal_authenticated_filte.description: The MAC filter representing the authenticated range.

authn_captive_portal_enabled.description: The flag that controls if this DHCP member is enabled for captive portal authentication.

authn_captive_portal_guest_filter.description: The MAC filter representing the guest range.

authn_server_group_enabled.description: The flag that controls if this DHCP member can send authentication requests to an authentication server group.

authority.description: The authority flag of a Grid member. This flag specifies if a DHCP server is authoritative for a domain.

bootfile.description: The name of a file that DHCP clients need to boot. This setting overrides the Grid level setting.

bootserver.description: The name of the server on which a boot file is stored. This setting overrides the Grid level setting.

ddns_domainname.description: The member DDNS domain name value.

ddns_generate_hostname.description: Determines the ability of a member DHCP server to generate a host name and update DNS with this host name when it receives a DHCP REQUEST message that does not include a host name.

ddns_retry_interval.description: Determines the retry interval when the member DHCP server makes repeated attempts to send DDNS updates to a DNS server.

ddns_server_always_updates.description: Determines that only the DHCP server is allowed to update DNS, regardless of the requests from the DHCP clients. This setting overrides the Grid level setting.

ddns_ttl.description: The DDNS TTL (Dynamic DNS Time To Live) value specifies the number of seconds an IP address for the name is cached.

ddns_update_fixed_addresses.description: Determines if the member DHCP server's ability to update the A and PTR records with a fixed address is enabled or not.

ddns_use_option81.description: Determines if support for option 81 is enabled or not.

ddns_zone_primaries.description: An ordered list of zone primaries that will receive DDNS updates.

deny_bootp.description: Determines if a BOOTP server denies BOOTP request or not. This setting overrides the Grid level setting.

dhcp_utilization.description: The percentage of the total DHCP utilization of DHCP objects belonging to the Grid Member multiplied by 1000. This is the percentage of the total number of available IP addresses from all the DHCP objects belonging to the Grid Member versus the total number of all IP addresses in all of the DHCP objects on the Grid Member.

dhcp_utilization_status.description: A string describing the utilization level of DHCP objects that belong to the Grid Member.

dns_update_style.description: The update style for dynamic DNS updates.

dynamic_hosts.description: The total number of DHCP leases issued for the DHCP objects on the Grid Member.

email_list.description: The email_list value of a member DHCP server.

enable_ddns.description: Determines if the member DHCP server's ability to send DDNS updates is enabled or not.

enable_dhcp.description: Determines if the DHCP service of a member is enabled or not.

enable_dhcp_on_ipv6_lan2.description: Determines if the DHCP service on the IPv6 LAN2 interface is enabled or not.

enable_dhcp_on_lan2.description: Determines if the DHCP service on the LAN2 interface is enabled or not.

enable_dhcp_thresholds.description: Represents the watermarks above or below which address usage in a network is unexpected and might warrant your attention. This setting overrides the Grid level setting.

enable_dhcpv6_service.description: Determines if DHCPv6 service for the member is enabled or not.

enable_email_warnings.description: Determines if e-mail warnings are enabled or disabled. When DHCP threshold is enabled and DHCP address usage crosses a watermark threshold, the appliance sends an e-mail notification to an administrator.

enable_fingerprint.description: Determines if fingerprint feature is enabled on this member. If you enable this feature, the server will match a fingerprint for incoming lease requests.

enable_gss_tsig.description: Determines whether the appliance is enabled to receive GSS-TSIG authenticated updates from DHCP clients.

enable_hostname_rewrite.description: Determines if the Grid member's host name rewrite feature is enabled or not.

enable_leasequery.description: Determines if lease query is allowed or not. This setting overrides the Grid-level setting.

enable_snmp_warnings.description: Determines if SNMP warnings are enabled or disabled on this DHCP member. When DHCP threshold is enabled and DHCP address usage crosses a watermark threshold, the appliance sends an SNMP trap to the trap receiver that was defined for the Grid member level.

extattrs.description: Extensible attributes associated with the object. For valid values for extensible attributes, see {extattrs:values}.

gss_tsig_keys.description: The list of GSS-TSIG keys for a member DHCP object.

high_water_mark.description: Determines the high watermark value of a member DHCP server. If the percentage of allocated addresses exceeds this watermark, the appliance makes a syslog entry and sends an e-mail notification (if enabled). Specifies the percentage of allocated addresses. The range is from 1 to 100.

high_water_mark_reset.description: Determines the high watermark reset value of a member DHCP server. If the percentage of allocated addresses drops below this value, a corresponding SNMP trap is reset. Specifies the percentage of allocated addresses. The range is from 1 to 100. The high watermark reset value must be lower than the high watermark value.

host_name.description: Host name of the Grid member.

hostname_rewrite_policy.description: The hostname rewrite policy that is in the protocol hostname rewrite policies array of the Grid DHCP object. This attribute is mandatory if enable_hostname_rewrite is "true".

ignore_dhcp_option_list_request.description: Determines if the ignore DHCP option list request flag of a Grid member DHCP is enabled or not. If this flag is set to true all available DHCP options will be returned to the client.

ignore_id.description: Indicates whether the appliance will ignore DHCP client IDs or MAC addresses. Valid values are "NONE", "CLIENT", or "MACADDR". The default is "NONE".

ignore_mac_addresses.description: A list of MAC addresses the appliance will ignore.

immediate_fa_configuration.description: Determines if the Immediate Fixed address configuration apply feature for the DHCP member is enabled or not.

ipv4addr.description: The IPv4 Address of the Grid member.

ipv6_ddns_domainname.description: The member DDNS IPv6 domain name value.

ipv6_ddns_enable_option_fqdn.description: Controls whether the FQDN option sent by the DHCPv6 client is to be used, or if the server can automatically generate the FQDN.

ipv6_ddns_hostname.description: The member IPv6 DDNS hostname value.

ipv6_ddns_server_always_updates.description: Determines if the server always updates DNS or updates only if requested by the client.

ipv6_ddns_ttl.description: The member IPv6 DDNS TTL value.

ipv6_dns_update_style.description: The update style for dynamic DHCPv6 DNS updates.

ipv6_domain_name_servers.description: The comma separated list of domain name server addresses in IPv6 address format.

ipv6_enable_ddns.description: Determines if sending DDNS updates by the member DHCPv6 server is enabled or not.

ipv6_enable_gss_tsig.description: Determines whether the appliance is enabled to receive GSS-TSIG authenticated updates from DHCPv6 clients.

ipv6_enable_lease_scavenging.description: Indicates whether DHCPv6 lease scavenging is enabled or disabled.

ipv6_enable_retry_updates.description: Determines if the DHCPv6 server retries failed dynamic DNS updates or not.

ipv6_generate_hostname.description: Determines if the server generates the hostname if it is not sent by the client.

ipv6_gss_tsig_keys.description: The list of GSS-TSIG keys for a member DHCPv6 object.

ipv6_kdc_server.description: Determines the IPv6 address or FQDN of the Kerberos server for DHCPv6 GSS-TSIG authentication. This setting overrides the Grid level setting.

ipv6_lease_scavenging_time.description: The member-level grace period (in seconds) to keep an expired lease before it is deleted by the scavenging process.

ipv6_microsoft_code_page.description: The Microsoft client DHCP IPv6 code page value of a Grid member. This value is the hostname translation code page for Microsoft DHCP IPv6 clients and overrides the Grid level Microsoft DHCP IPv6 client code page.

ipv6_options.description: An array of DHCP option dhcpoption structs that lists the DHCPv6 options associated with the object.

ipv6_recycle_leases.description: Determines if the IPv6 recycle leases feature is enabled or not. If the feature is enabled, leases are kept in the Recycle Bin until one week after lease expiration. When the feature is disabled, the leases are irrecoverably deleted.

ipv6_remember_expired_client_association.description: Enable binding for expired DHCPv6 leases.

ipv6_retry_updates_interval.description: Determines the retry interval when the member DHCPv6 server makes repeated attempts to send DDNS updates to a DNS server.

ipv6_server_duid.description: The server DHCPv6 unique identifier (DUID) for the Grid member.

ipv6_update_dns_on_lease_renewal.description: Controls whether the DHCPv6 server updates DNS when an IPv6 DHCP lease is renewed.

ipv6addr.description: The IPv6 Address of the Grid member.

kdc_server.description: The IPv4 address or FQDN of the Kerberos server for DHCPv4 GSS-TSIG authentication. This setting overrides the Grid level setting.

lease_per_client_settings.description: Defines how the appliance releases DHCP leases. Valid values are "RELEASE_MACHING_ID", "NEVER_RELEASE", or "ONE_LEASE_PER_CLIENT". The default is "RELEASE_MATCHING_ID".

lease_scavenge_time.description: Determines the lease scavenging time value. When this field is set, the appliance permanently deletes the free and backup leases that remain in the database beyond a specified period of time. To disable lease scavenging, set the parameter to -1. The minimum positive value must be greater than 86400 seconds (1 day).

log_lease_events.description: This value specifies whether the grid member logs lease events. This setting overrides the Grid level setting.

logic_filter_rules.description: This field contains the logic filters to be applied on the Grid member. This list corresponds to the match rules that are written to the dhcpd configuration file.

low_water_mark.description: Determines the low watermark value. If the percent of allocated addresses drops below this watermark, the appliance makes a syslog entry and sends an e-mail notification (if enabled).

low_water_mark_reset.description: Determines the low watermark reset value. If the percentage of allocated addresses exceeds this value, a corresponding SNMP trap is reset. A number that specifies the percentage of allocated addresses. The range is from 1 to 100. The low watermark reset value must be higher than the low watermark value.

microsoft_code_page.description: The Microsoft client DHCP IPv4 code page value of a grid member. This value is the hostname translation code page for Microsoft DHCP IPv4 clients and overrides the Grid level Microsoft DHCP IPv4 client code page.

nextserver.description: The next server value of a member DHCP server. This value is the IP address or name of the boot file server on which the boot file is stored.

option60_match_rules.description: The list of option 60 match rules.

options.description: An array of DHCP option dhcpoption structs that lists the DHCP options associated with the object.

ping_count.description: Specifies the number of pings that the Infoblox appliance sends to an IP address to verify that it is not in use. Values are from 0 to 10, where 0 disables pings.

ping_timeout.description: Indicates the number of milliseconds the appliance waits for a response to its ping. Valid values are 100, 500, 1000, 2000, 3000, 4000 and 5000 milliseconds.

prefix_length_mode.description: The Prefix length mode for DHCPv6.

pxe_lease_time.description: Specifies the duration of time it takes a host to connect to a boot server, such as a TFTP server, and download the file it needs to boot. A 32-bit unsigned integer that represents the duration, in seconds, for which the update is cached. Zero indicates that the update is not cached.

recycle_leases.description: Determines if the recycle leases feature is enabled or not. If you enabled this feature and then delete a DHCP range, the appliance stores active leases from this range up to one week after the leases expires.

retry_ddns_updates.description: Indicates whether the DHCP server makes repeated attempts to send DDNS updates to a DNS server.

static_hosts.description: The number of static DHCP addresses configured in DHCP objects that belong to the Grid Member.

syslog_facility.description: The syslog facility is the location on the syslog server to which you want to sort the syslog messages.

total_hosts.description: The total number of DHCP addresses configured in DHCP objects that belong to the Grid Member.

update_dns_on_lease_renewal.description: Controls whether the DHCP server updates DNS when a DHCP lease is renewed.

use_enable_dhcp_thresholds.description: Use flag for: enable_dhcp_thresholds , high_water_mark, high_water_mark_reset, low_water_mark, low_water_mark_reset

use_ipv6_lease_scavenging.description: Use flag for: ipv6_enable_lease_scavenging , ipv6_lease_scavenging_time, ipv6_remember_expired_client_association

valid_lifetime.description: The valid lifetime for Grid Member DHCP. Specifies the length of time addresses that are assigned to DHCPv6 clients remain in the valid state.

dns_grid_zone.description: The ref of a DNS zone.

dns_grid_primary.description: The name of a Grid member.

dns_ext_zone.description: The name of external zone in FQDN format.

dns_ext_primary.description: The IP address of the External server. Valid when zone_match is "EXTERNAL" or "ANY_EXTERNAL".

num.description: The code of the DHCP option.

vendor_class.description: The name of the space this DHCP option is associated to.

use_option.description: Only applies to special options that are displayed separately from other options and have a use flag. These options are: * routers * router-templates * domain-name-servers * domain-name * broadcast-address * broadcast-address-offset * dhcp-lease-time * dhcp6.name-servers

type.description: The filter type. Valid values are: * MAC * NAC * Option

match_value.description: The match value for this DHCP Option 60 match rule.

option_space.description: The option space for this DHCP Option 60 match rule.

is_substring.description: Determines if the match value is a substring.

substring_offset.description: The offset of match value for this DHCP Option 60 match rule.

substring_length.description: The length of match value for this DHCP Option 60 match rule.

num.description: The code of the DHCP option.

vendor_class.description: The name of the space this DHCP option is associated to.

use_option.description: Only applies to special options that are displayed separately from other options and have a use flag. These options are: * routers * router-templates * domain-name-servers * domain-name * broadcast-address * broadcast-address-offset * dhcp-lease-time * dhcp6.name-servers

add_client_ip_mac_options.description: Add custom IP, MAC and DNS View name ENDS0 options to outgoing recursive queries.

additional_ip_list.description: The list of additional IP addresses on which DNS is enabled for a Grid member. Only one of "additional_ip_list" or "additional_ip_list_struct" should be set when modifying the object.

additional_ip_list_struct.description: The list of additional IP addresses and IP Space Discriminator short names on which DNS is enabled for a Grid member. Only one of "additional_ip_list" or "additional_ip_list_struct" should be set when modifying the object.

allow_gss_tsig_zone_updates.description: Determines whether the GSS-TSIG zone updates is enabled for the Grid member.

allow_query.description: Determines if queries from specified IPv4 or IPv6 addresses and networks are enabled or not. The appliance can also use Transaction Signature (TSIG) keys to authenticate the queries. This setting overrides the Grid query settings.

allow_recursive_query.description: Determines if the responses to recursive queries is enabled or not. This setting overrides Grid recursive query settings.

allow_transfer.description: Allows or rejects zone transfers from specified IPv4 or IPv6 addresses and networks or allows transfers from hosts authenticated by Transaction signature (TSIG) key. This setting overrides the Grid zone transfer settings.

allow_update.description: Allows or rejects dynamic updates from specified IPv4 or IPv6 addresses, networks or from host authenticated by TSIG key. This setting overrides Grid update settings.

anonymize_response_logging.description: The flag that indicates whether the anonymization of captured DNS responses is enabled or disabled.

atc_fwd_enable.description: Enable DNS recursive query forwarding to Active Trust Cloud.

auto_create_a_and_ptr_for_lan2.description: Determines if the auto-generation of A and PTR records for the LAN2 IP address is enabled or not, if DNS service is enabled on LAN2.

auto_create_aaaa_and_ipv6ptr_for_lan2.description: Determines if auto-generation of AAAA and IPv6 PTR records for LAN2 IPv6 address is enabled or not.

auto_sort_views.description: Determines if a Grid member to automatically sort DNS views is enabled or not. The order of the DNS views determines the order in which the appliance checks the match lists.

bind_check_names_policy.description: The BIND check names policy, which indicates the action the appliance takes when it encounters host names that do not comply with the Strict Hostname Checking policy. This method applies only if the host name restriction policy is set to 'Strict Hostname Checking'.

bind_hostname_directive.description: The value of the hostname directive for BIND.

bind_hostname_directive_fqdn.description: The value of the user-defined hostname directive for BIND. To enable user-defined hostname directive, you must set the bind_hostname_directive to "USER_DEFINED".

blackhole_list.description: The list of IPv4 or IPv6 addresses and networks from which DNS queries are blocked. This setting overrides the Grid blackhole_list.

blacklist_action.description: The action to perform when a domain name matches the pattern defined in a rule that is specified by the blacklist_ruleset method.

blacklist_log_query.description: Determines if blacklist redirection queries are logged or not.

blacklist_redirect_addresses.description: The IP addresses the appliance includes in the response it sends in place of a blacklisted IP address.

blacklist_redirect_ttl.description: The TTL value of the synthetic DNS responses that result from blacklist redirection.

blacklist_rulesets.description: The DNS Ruleset object names assigned at the Grid level for blacklist redirection.

capture_dns_queries_on_all_domains.description: The flag that indicates whether the capture of DNS queries for all domains is enabled or disabled.

check_names_for_ddns_and_zone_transfer.description: Determines whether the application of BIND check-names for zone transfers and DDNS updates are enabled.

copy_client_ip_mac_options.description: Copy custom IP, MAC and DNS View name ENDS0 options from incoming to outgoing recursive queries.

copy_xfer_to_notify.description: Copies the allowed IPs from the zone transfer list into the also-notify statement in the named.conf file.

custom_root_name_servers.description: The list of custom root name servers. You can either select and use Internet root name servers or specify custom root name servers by providing a host name and IP address to which the Infoblox appliance can send queries.

disable_edns.description: The EDNS0 support for queries that require recursive resolution on Grid members.

dns64_groups.description: The list of DNS64 synthesis groups associated with this member.

dns_cache_acceleration_ttl.description: The minimum TTL value, in seconds, that a DNS record must have in order for it to be cached by the DNS Cache Acceleration service. An integer from 1 to 65000 that represents the TTL in seconds.

dns_health_check_anycast_control.description: The flag that indicates whether the anycast failure (BFD session down) is enabled on member failure or not.

dns_health_check_domain_list.description: The list of domain names for the DNS health check.

dns_health_check_interval.description: The time interval (in seconds) for DNS health check.

dns_health_check_recursion_flag.description: The flag that indicates whether the recursive DNS health check is enabled or not.

dns_health_check_retries.description: The number of DNS health check retries.

dns_health_check_timeout.description: The DNS health check timeout interval (in seconds).

dns_notify_transfer_source.description: Determines which IP address is used as the source for DDNS notify and transfer operations.

dns_notify_transfer_source_address.description: The source address used if dns_notify_transfer_source type is "IP".

dns_query_capture_file_time_limit.description: The time limit (in minutes) for the DNS query capture file.

dns_query_source_address.description: The source address used if dns_query_source_interface type is "IP".

dns_query_source_interface.description: Determines which IP address is used as the source for DDNS query operations.

dns_view_address_settings.description: Array of notify/query source settings for views.

dnssec_blacklist_enabled.description: Determines if the blacklist rules for DNSSEC-enabled clients are enabled or not.

dnssec_dns64_enabled.description: Determines if the DNS64 groups for DNSSEC-enabled clients are enabled or not.

dnssec_enabled.description: Determines if the DNS security extension is enabled or not.

dnssec_expired_signatures_enabled.description: Determines when the DNS member accepts expired signatures.

dnssec_negative_trust_anchors.description: A list of zones for which the server does not perform DNSSEC validation.

dnssec_nxdomain_enabled.description: Determines if the NXDOMAIN rules for DNSSEC-enabled clients are enabled or not.

dnssec_rpz_enabled.description: Determines if the RPZ policies for DNSSEC-enabled clients are enabled or not.

dnssec_trusted_keys.description: The list of trusted keys for the DNSSEC feature.

dnssec_validation_enabled.description: Determines if the DNS security validation is enabled or not.

domains_to_capture_dns_queries.description: The list of domains for DNS query capture.

dtc_dns_queries_specific_behavior.description: Setting to control specific behavior for DTC DNS responses for incoming lbdn matched queries.

dtc_edns_prefer_client_subnet.description: Determines whether to prefer the client address from the edns-client-subnet option for DTC or not.

dtc_health_source_address.description: The source address used if dtc_health_source type is "IP".

edns_udp_size.description: Advertises the EDNS0 buffer size to the upstream server. The value should be between 512 and 4096 bytes. The recommended value is between 512 and 1220 bytes.

enable_blackhole.description: Determines if the blocking of DNS queries is enabled or not. This setting overrides the Grid enable_blackhole settings.

enable_blacklist.description: Determines if a blacklist is enabled or not on the Grid member.

enable_capture_dns_queries.description: The flag that indicates whether the capture of DNS queries is enabled or disabled.

enable_capture_dns_responses.description: The flag that indicates whether the capture of DNS responses is enabled or disabled.

enable_dns.description: Determines if the DNS service of a member is enabled or not.

enable_dns64.description: Determines if the DNS64 support is enabled or not for this member.

enable_dns_cache_acceleration.description: Determines if the DNS Cache Acceleration service is enabled or not for a member.

enable_dns_health_check.description: The flag that indicates whether the DNS health check is enabled or not.

enable_dnstap_queries.description: Determines whether the query messages need to be forwarded to DNSTAP or not.

enable_dnstap_responses.description: Determines whether the response messages need to be forwarded to DNSTAP or not.

enable_dnstap_violations_tls.description: Determines whether the violations messages need to be forwarded to DNSTAP or not.

enable_excluded_domain_names.description: The flag that indicates whether excluding domain names from captured DNS queries and responses is enabled or disabled.

enable_fixed_rrset_order_fqdns.description: Determines if the fixed RRset order FQDN is enabled or not.

enable_ftc.description: Determines whether Fault Tolerant Caching (FTC) is enabled.

enable_gss_tsig.description: Determines whether the appliance is enabled to receive GSS-TSIG authenticated updates from DHCP clients.

enable_notify_source_port.description: Determines if the notify source port for a member is enabled or not.

enable_query_rewrite.description: Determines if the DNS query rewrite is enabled or not for this member.

enable_query_source_port.description: Determines if the query source port for a memer is enabled or not.

excluded_domain_names.description: The list of domains that are excluded from DNS query and response capture.

extattrs.description: Extensible attributes associated with the object. For valid values for extensible attributes, see {extattrs:values}.

filter_aaaa.description: The type of AAAA filtering for this member DNS object.

filter_aaaa_list.description: The list of IPv4 addresses and networks from which queries are received. AAAA filtering is applied to these addresses.

fixed_rrset_order_fqdns.description: The fixed RRset order FQDN. If this field does not contain an empty value, the appliance will automatically set the enable_fixed_rrset_order_fqdns field to 'true', unless the same request sets the enable field to 'false'.

forward_only.description: Permits this member to send queries to forwarders only. When the value is "true", the member sends queries to forwarders only, and not to other internal or Internet root servers.

forward_updates.description: Allows secondary servers to forward updates to the DNS server. This setting overrides grid update settings.

forwarders.description: The forwarders for the member. A forwarder is essentially a name server to which other name servers first send all of their off-site queries. The forwarder builds up a cache of information, avoiding the need for the other name servers to send queries off-site. This setting overrides the Grid level setting.

ftc_expired_record_timeout.description: The timeout interval (in seconds) after which the expired Fault Tolerant Caching (FTC)record is stale and no longer valid.

ftc_expired_record_ttl.description: The TTL value (in seconds) of the expired Fault Tolerant Caching (FTC) record in DNS responses.

glue_record_addresses.description: The list of glue record addresses.

gss_tsig_keys.description: The list of GSS-TSIG keys for a member DNS object.

host_name.description: The host name of the Grid member.

ipv4addr.description: The IPv4 Address of the Grid member.

ipv6_glue_record_addresses.description: The list of IPv6 glue record addresses.

ipv6addr.description: The IPv6 Address of the Grid member.

max_cache_ttl.description: The maximum time (in seconds) for which the server will cache positive answers.

max_cached_lifetime.description: The maximum time in seconds a DNS response can be stored in the hardware acceleration cache. Valid values are unsigned integer between 60 and 86400, inclusive.

max_ncache_ttl.description: The maximum time (in seconds) for which the server will cache negative (NXDOMAIN) responses. The maximum allowed value is 604800.

max_udp_size.description: The value is used by authoritative DNS servers to never send DNS responses larger than the configured value. The value should be between 512 and 4096 bytes. The recommended value is between 512 and 1220 bytes.

minimal_resp.description: Enables the ability to return a minimal amount of data in response to a query. This capability speeds up the DNS services provided by the appliance.

notify_delay.description: Specifies the number of seconds of delay the notify messages are sent to secondaries.

notify_source_port.description: The source port for notify messages. When requesting zone transfers from the primary server, some secondary DNS servers use the source port number (the primary server used to send the notify message) as the destination port number in the zone transfer request. This setting overrides Grid static source port settings. Valid values are between 1 and 63999. The default is selected by BIND.

nxdomain_log_query.description: Determines if NXDOMAIN redirection queries are logged or not.

nxdomain_redirect_ttl.description: The TTL value of synthetic DNS responses that result from NXDOMAIN redirection.

nxdomain_rulesets.description: The names of the Ruleset objects assigned at the Grid level for NXDOMAIN redirection.

query_source_port.description: The source port for queries. Specifying a source port number for recursive queries ensures that a firewall will allow the response. Valid values are between 1 and 63999. The default is selected by BIND.

recursive_client_limit.description: A limit on the number of concurrent recursive clients.

recursive_query_list.description: The list of IPv4 or IPv6 addresses, networks or hosts authenticated by Transaction signature (TSIG) key from which recursive queries are allowed or denied.

recursive_resolver.description: The recursive resolver for member DNS. UNBOUND support has been deprecated from NIOS 9.0 onwards.

resolver_query_timeout.description: The recursive query timeout for the member. The value must be 0 or between 10 and 30.

root_name_server_type.description: Determines the type of root name servers.

rpz_disable_nsdname_nsip.description: Enables NSDNAME and NSIP resource records from RPZ feeds at member level.

rpz_drop_ip_rule_enabled.description: Enables the appliance to ignore RPZ-IP triggers with prefix lengths less than the specified minimum prefix length.

rpz_drop_ip_rule_min_prefix_length_ipv4.description: The minimum prefix length for IPv4 RPZ-IP triggers. The appliance ignores RPZ-IP triggers with prefix lengths less than the specified minimum IPv4 prefix length.

rpz_drop_ip_rule_min_prefix_length_ipv6.description: The minimum prefix length for IPv6 RPZ-IP triggers. The appliance ignores RPZ-IP triggers with prefix lengths less than the specified minimum IPv6 prefix length.

rpz_qname_wait_recurse.description: The flag that indicates whether recursive RPZ lookups are enabled.

serial_query_rate.description: The number of maximum concurrent SOA queries per second for the member.

server_id_directive.description: The value of the server-id directive for BIND and Unbound DNS.

server_id_directive_string.description: The value of the user-defined hostname directive for BIND DNS. To enable user-defined hostname directive, you must set the bind_hostname_directive to "USER_DEFINED".

skip_in_grid_rpz_queries.description: Determines if RPZ rules are applied to queries originated from this member and received by other Grid members.

sortlist.description: A sort list determines the order of addresses in responses made to DNS queries. This setting overrides Grid sort list settings.

store_locally.description: The flag that indicates whether the storage of query capture reports on the appliance is enabled or disabled.

syslog_facility.description: The syslog facility. This is the location on the syslog server to which you want to sort the DNS logging messages. This setting overrides the Grid logging facility settings.

tcp_idle_timeout.description: TCP Idle timeout for DNS over TLS connections.

transfer_excluded_servers.description: Excludes specified DNS servers during zone transfers.

transfer_format.description: The BIND format for a zone transfer. This provides tracking capabilities for single or multiple transfers and their associated servers.

transfers_in.description: The number of maximum concurrent transfers for the member.

transfers_out.description: The number of maximum outbound concurrent zone transfers for the member.

transfers_per_ns.description: The number of maximum concurrent transfers per member for the member.

upstream_address_family_preference.description: Upstream address family preference when dual mode is configured.

use_dnstap_setting.description: Use flag for: enable_dnstap_queries , enable_dnstap_responses, enable_dnstap_violations_tls, dnstap_setting

use_ftc.description: Use flag for: enable_ftc , ftc_expired_record_ttl, ftc_expired_record_timeout

use_lan2_ipv6_port.description: Determines if the DNS service on the IPv6 LAN2 port is enabled or not.

use_lan2_port.description: Determines if the DNS service on the LAN2 port is enabled or not.

use_lan_ipv6_port.description: Determines if the DNS service on the IPv6 LAN port is enabled or not.

use_lan_port.description: Determines the status of the use of DNS services on the IPv4 LAN1 port.

use_mgmt_ipv6_port.description: Determines if the DNS services on the IPv6 MGMT port is enabled or not.

use_mgmt_port.description: Determines if the DNS services on the MGMT port is enabled or not.

use_nxdomain_redirect.description: Use flag for: nxdomain_redirect , nxdomain_redirect_addresses, nxdomain_redirect_addresses_v6, nxdomain_redirect_ttl, nxdomain_log_query, nxdomain_rulesets

use_root_name_server.description: Use flag for: root_name_server_type , custom_root_name_servers, use_root_server_for_all_views

use_root_server_for_all_views.description: Determines if root name servers should be applied to all views or only to Default view.

use_rpz_drop_ip_rule.description: Use flag for: rpz_drop_ip_rule_enabled , rpz_drop_ip_rule_min_prefix_length_ipv4, rpz_drop_ip_rule_min_prefix_length_ipv6

use_source_ports.description: Use flag for: enable_notify_source_port , notify_source_port, enable_query_source_port, query_source_port

enable_fetches_per_server.description: Enables or disables the configuration of the maximum number of concurrent recursive queries the appliance sends to each upstream DNS server.

enable_fetches_per_zone.description: Enables or disables the configuration of the maximum number of concurrent recursive queries the appliance sends to each DNS zone.

enable_holddown.description: Enables or disables the holddown configuration when the appliance stops sending queries to non-responsive servers.

fetches_per_zone.description: The maximum number of concurrent recursive queries that a server sends for its domains.

fps_freq.description: Determines how often (in number of recursive responses) the appliance recalculates the average timeout ratio for each DNS server.

holddown.description: The holddown duration for non-responsive servers.

holddown_threshold.description: The number of consecutive timeouts before holding down a non-responsive server.

holddown_timeout.description: The minimum time (in seconds) that needs to be passed before a timeout occurs. Note that only these timeouts are counted towards the number of consecutive timeouts.

allow_distribution.description: Determines if distribution is allowed for the Grid.

allow_distribution_scheduling.description: Determines if distribution scheduling is allowed.

allow_upgrade.description: Determines if upgrade is allowed for the Grid.

allow_upgrade_cancel.description: Determines if the Grid is allowed to cancel an upgrade.

allow_upgrade_pause.description: Determines if the Grid is allowed to pause an upgrade.

allow_upgrade_resume.description: Determines if the Grid is allowed to resume an upgrade.

allow_upgrade_scheduling.description: Determine if the Grid is allowed to schedule an upgrade.

allow_upgrade_test.description: Determines if the Grid is allowed to test an upgrade.

allow_upload.description: Determine if the Grid is allowed to upload a build.

comment.description: Comment in readable format for an upgrade group a or virtual node.

current_version_summary.description: Current version summary for the 'type' requested. This field can be requested for the Grid, a certain group that has virtual nodes as subelements, or for the overall group status.

distribution_schedule_active.description: Determines if the distribution schedule is active for the Grid.

distribution_schedule_time.description: The Grid master distribution schedule time.

distribution_state.description: The current state of distribution process.

distribution_version_summary.description: Distribution version summary for the 'type' requested. This field can be requested for the Grid, a certain group that has virtual nodes as subelements, or for the overall group status.

element_status.description: The status of a certain element with regards to the type requested.

ipv4_address.description: The IPv4 Address of virtual node or physical one.

ipv6_address.description: The IPv6 Address of virtual node or physical one.

member.description: Member that participates in the upgrade process.

pnode_role.description: Status of the physical node in the HA pair.

reverted.description: Determines if the upgrade process is reverted.

status_value.description: Status of a certain group, virtual node or physical node.

status_value_update_time.description: Timestamp of when the status was updated.

steps.description: The list of upgrade process steps.

steps_total.description: Total number steps in the upgrade process.

subelement_type.description: The type of subelements to be requested. If 'type' is 'GROUP', or 'VNODE', then 'upgrade_group' or 'member' should have proper values for an operation to return data specific for the values passed. Otherwise, overall data is returned for every group or physical node.

subelements_completed.description: Number of subelements that have accomplished an upgrade.

subelements_status.description: The upgrade process information of subelements.

subelements_total.description: Number of subelements number in a certain group, virtual node, or the Grid.

type.description: The type of upper level elements to be requested.

upgrade_group.description: Upgrade group that participates in the upgrade process.

upgrade_schedule_active.description: Determines if the upgrade schedule is active.

upgrade_state.description: The upgrade state of the Grid.

upgrade_test_status.description: The upgrade test status of the Grid.

upload_version_summary.description: Upload version summary for the 'type' requested. This field can be requested for the Grid, a certain group that has virtual nodes as subelements, or overall group status.

status_text.description: The status text of the hotfix.

status_value.description: The status value of a step.

status_text.description: The status text that describes a step.

allowed_object_types.description: The object types this extensible attribute is allowed to associate with.

comment.description: Comment for the Extensible Attribute Definition; maximum 256 characters.

default_value.description: Default value used to pre-populate the attribute value in the GUI. For email, URL, and string types, the value is a string with a maximum of 256 characters. For an integer, the value is an integer from -2147483648 through 2147483647. For a date, the value is the number of seconds that have elapsed since January 1st, 1970 UTC.

flags.description: This field contains extensible attribute flags. Possible values: (A)udited, (C)loud API, Cloud (G)master, (I)nheritable, (L)isted, (M)andatory value, MGM (P)rivate, (R)ead Only, (S)ort enum values, Multiple (V)alues If there are two or more flags in the field, you must list them according to the order they are listed above. For example, 'CR' is a valid value for the 'flags' field because C = Cloud API is listed before R = Read only. However, the value 'RC' is invalid because the order for the 'flags' field is broken.

list_values.description: List of Values. Applicable if the extensible attribute type is ENUM.

max.description: Maximum allowed value of extensible attribute. Applicable if the extensible attribute type is INTEGER.

min.description: Minimum allowed value of extensible attribute. Applicable if the extensible attribute type is INTEGER.

name.description: The name of the Extensible Attribute Definition.

namespace.description: Namespace for the Extensible Attribute Definition.

type.description: Type for the Extensible Attribute Definition.

option_with_ea.description: This option describes which action must be taken if the extensible attribute exists for both the parent and descendant objects: * INHERIT: inherit the extensible attribute from the parent object. * RETAIN: retain the value of an extensible attribute that was set for the child object. * CONVERT: the value of the extensible attribute must be copied from the parent object.

option_without_ea.description: This option describes which action must be taken if the extensible attribute exists for the parent, but is absent from the descendant object: * INHERIT: inherit the extensible attribute from the parent object. * NOT_INHERIT: do nothing.

option_delete_ea.description: This option describes which action must be taken if the extensible attribute exists for the descendant, but is absent for the parent object: * RETAIN: retain the extensible attribute value for the descendant object. * REMOVE: remove this extensible attribute from the descendant object.
